result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael T. Grossklaus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  

SAFE program, intake, assessment and successful completion. 

DNA sample.

Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.  

No contact with victim unless approved by agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael T. Grossklaus

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:   2:43 p.m. 
INCLUDES 21CM986, 18CF112, 22CM417.
State appears by ADA Natalie Zibolski. 
Defendant appears in custody from MCJ with Atty Peter Rotter. 

Date and time set for SAR on 21CM986 and 18CF112; plea/sentencing on 22CM417.

SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION>>
Parties have stipulated agreement; State recites for record.  
COURT ORDERS the following: 

21CM986: 
Count 1 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater)>>2 years WI State Prison (1 year IC/1 year ES); concurrent with each other.  COURT grants 115 days credit.  

18CF112: 
Count 1 (Manuf/Delivery Amphetamine >3-10g/Repeater)>>6 years WI State Prison (2 years IC/4 years ES); concurrent with each other.  COURT grants 115 days credit. 

CONDITIONS of ES: Any assessment, treatment, counseling as recommended by agent.  Payment of any outstanding court costs.  Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.  Defendant is eligible for CIP/SAP. 


PLEA/SENTENCING 22CM417>>
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

PLEA: 
Count 1 (Disorderly Conduct/Repeater/DA)>>>GUILTY.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: 2 years WI State Prison (1 year EC/1 year ES); concurrent with each other.  

CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  SAFE program, intake, assessment and successful completion. Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.  No contact with victim unless approved by agent.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge and Domestic Abuse surcharge.  COURT grants 101 days credit.  Defendant is eligible for CIP/SAP. 

Adj:  3:02 p.m.
Marathon County Victim Waiver of No Contact Bond Condition- B.R.

Jury status hearing on October 14, 2022 at 09:40 am.
Jury Trial on November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

No contact with victim(s): B.R.R.; Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 1 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Amy. 
Case called:  2:10 p.m. 

State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo for ADA Natalie Zibolski.   Defendant appears in custody by video from MCJ with Atty Trevor Peterson.  

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction.  
PLEA: Not guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: $300.00 signature bond.  

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): B.R.R. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 1 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  

PTC:  6/21/22 at 2:00 p.m. 
FPT/TP:  8/11/22 at 2:10 p.m.
